node.title: Beyonce opens 2022 Oscars with first live performance in two years
node.description: After two years away, Queen Bey returned in a big way by performing "Be Alive," which was nominated for best original song.
node.content: ["After two years away from live performances, Queen Bey returned in a big way. The multi Grammy Award-winning artist kicked off the 2022 Oscars with a performance of \"Be Alive,\" which was nominated for best original song.", "The song was written for the film \"King Richard,\" which tells the story of tennis stars Serena and Venus Williams father, Richard, and their upbringing. Beyonce\u0301 Knowles and her backup dancers, including daughter Blue Ivy, were all decked out in neon yellow to mimic the color of a tennis ball. The performance took place on a tennis court in Compton, California, where the Williams sisters grew up.\u00a0", "Serena and Venus Williams, who served as executive producers on the film, introduced the performance. The song is one of triumph after despair, and speaks to the unwavering determination and drive of the Williams family.  ", "Beyonce's last broadcast performance was at Kobe and Gianna Bryant's 2020 memorial, A Celebration of Life.", "\"King Richard\" is nominated for best picture and Will Smith, who plays Serena and Venus Williams' father, Richard Williams, is nominated for best actor.\u00a0\u00a0", "For a full list of the 94th Academy Awards nominations and winners, click here.", "Tre'Vaughn Howard is a digital associate producer and writer for CBS News, focusing on international and culture stories."]
